metadata.title: CVE-2019-25162 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: i2c:Fix a potential use after free Free the adap structure only after we aredone using it. This patch just moves the put_device() down a bit to avoidthe use after free. [wsa: added comment to the code, added Fixes tag]

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-197.208~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').

linux-aws-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1143.155~16.04.1').

linux-gcp package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1138.154~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1108.119~16.04.1').
